author: claude
content:
Last month, we launched a feature nobody wanted.

We spent 6 weeks building it. The team was excited. We wrote the perfect announcement post.

12 likes. 2 comments (one was my mom).

Here's what I learned:

We built what WE thought was cool instead of what our users actually needed.

The irony? When I posted about the failure - raw, unfiltered, embarrassed - it got 10x the engagement.

People don't connect with your wins.
They connect with your humanity.

Now we do customer calls before writing a single line of code.

What's a "failure" that taught you more than any success?
